preface.title: About This Document
preface.para: This manual describes how to install and configure client applications that enable you to connect to and use a Trafodion database.

section.title: Intended Audience
section.para: This manual is intended for users who want to connect to and use a Trafodion database.

section.title: New and Changed Information in This Edition
section.para: This manual shows updated versions for Trafodion Release 1.1.0. It also provides instructions on how to download and install Trafodion odb, a new multi-threaded, ODBC-based command-line tool for parallel data loading and extracting. See .

section.title: Installing the Trafodion ODBC Driver for Windows

note.para: To install the driver on your PC, you must be logged on with a user ID that has administrator privileges.

section.title: Task 1: Download the ODBC client installation file

step.para: Create a download folder on the client workstation.
Open a Web browser and navigate to the Trafodion downloads site ().
Click on the clients-1.1.n.tar.gz link to start downloading the Trafodion clients tar file to your workstation.
Place the clients-1.1.n.tar.gz file into the download folder.
Extract the contents of the clients-1.1.n.tar.gz file by using an extract tool like WinZip.
The package file contains the TFODBC64-1.1.n.msi installer file, which is extracted to the clients subdirectory.

section.title: Task 2: Start the InstallShield wizard
section.para: The InstallShield wizard walks you through the steps to install the client components (Trafodion ODBC 1.0) on your workstation. You can perform the installation in interactive mode, in which you provide input or accept defaults when prompted as ODBC is installed. See .You can perform this installation in interactive mode or in passive or quiet mode:

listitem.para: In interactive mode, you provide input or accept defaults when prompted as ODBC is installed. See .
In quiet mode, the installation proceeds without your input. You can, however, invoke the installer with parameters that override the default values. See .

step.para: Double-click the .msi distribution file to start the InstallShield wizard.
On the Welcome page, click Next.
On the Destination Folder page, click Next to select the default location:
This location is the installation directory for ODBC header and help files. All other ODBC files are installed in %SYSTEMROOT%\system32.
On the Set Certificate Directory page, click Next to accept the default location for the security certificate (SYSTEM_DEFAULT).
On the Ready to Install the Program page, click Install. The installation begins.
The Installing Trafodion ODBC64 1.0 page displays a progress bar.
On the InstallShield Wizard Completed page, click Finish to exit the wizard. Do not add a new Trafodion ODBC data source to the MS ODBC Administrator until you have restarted your system.

section.title: Quiet Mode Installation
section.para: Use the Windows installer command, msiexec, to perform quiet mode installation. The installer proceeds without your interactive input.
To perform a quiet mode installation that accepts standard defaults, use the msiexec command as in this example: msiexec /qn /i "TFODBC64-1.1.n.msi"
Suppose that you want to perform a quiet mode installation that changes the default installation location:
You can provide a custom location by invoking the Windows installer with this syntax:

In this case, the default location for installation is changed to the location specified by directory. This location is the installation directory for ODBC header and help files. All other ODBC files are installed in %SYSTEMROOT%\system32. If any element of the pathname contains a space or other special character, enclose the pathname in quotation marks (for example, "C:\Program Files\ODBC").

section.title: Task 3: Add a client data source

step.para: Start the Microsoft ODBC Administrator:

listitem.para: On Windows 7: Start > All Programs > Trafodion ODBC 1.0 > MS ODBC Administrator
On Windows 8: Right-click the Trafodion ODBC 1.0 icon on the desktop and select MS ODBC Administrator.

step.para: In the ODBC Data Source Administrator dialog box, click Add.
Select TRAF ODBC 1.0, and then click Finish to start the Create a New Trafodion ODBC Data Source wizard.
Enter the data source name (for example, Default_DataSource_Schema1) and an optional description, and click Next.
Enter the IP address or host name for the database platform. Enter the port number as 23400. Leave the defaults as is, and click Next.
Enter the schema name. The default schema name is SEABASE. Click Next.
Enter the translate DLL name and its option, if you have one. If not, leave it blank. Leave the localization defaults as is.

The Replacement Character replaces any character that is incompatible for translation when retrieving data. It is one character (one or two bytes long). The Replacement Character is assumed to be in the character set specified in the Client/Server Character Set Interaction. If it is not specified, '?' is used as the default.
Click Next.
Select the trace options, if desired. Change the Log File Path to the location you want, or leave the default as is, and click Finish.
The wizard gives you an opportunity to test the connection. Click Test Connection and click OK.
The server ID and schema are filled in for you. Enter a valid user name and password, and click OK.
The wizard attempts to connect to the data source and displays a message stating whether it was successful or not.
Click OK to save the data source, or click Cancel twice to quit the Create Data Source wizard.

section.title: Reinstalling the Trafodion ODBC Driver for Windows
section.para: To reinstall the driver, we recommend that you fully remove your ODBC driver and then install the new version. See and then .

section.title: Uninstalling the Trafodion ODBC Driver for Windows

step.para: Start to remove the ODBC driver:

listitem.para: On Windows 7: Start > All Programs > Trafodion ODBC 1.0 > Remove TRAF ODBC 1.0
On Windows 8: Right-click the Trafodion ODBC 1.0 icon on the desktop and select Remove TRAF ODBC 1.0.

step.para: When the Windows Installer dialog box asks you if you want to uninstall this product, click Yes.
The Trafodion ODBC 1.0 dialog box displays the status and asks you to wait while Windows configures Trafodion ODBC 1.0 (that is, removes the Trafodion ODBC Driver from your Windows workstation).
After this dialog box disappears, Trafodion ODBC 1.0 is no longer on your workstation.

note.para: Uninstalling the ODBC driver does not remove pre-existing data source definitions from the Windows registry.

section.title: Setting Up the Client Environment
section.para: All client data sources connect to the preconfigured server data source on the database platform, which is Default_DataSource. You can configure only one data source, Default_DataSource, on the database platform, but you can create other data source definitions on the workstation. For example, if you have more than one schema on the database platform and you want to connect to each of those schemas on the database platform, you can create a client data source for each of those schemas. Instead of changing the schema definition in the data source definition on the workstation, you can create multiple data source definitions with different schemas on the workstation. The client data source will use the specified schema but will connect to Default_DataSource on the database platform.
To create a data source on the client workstation, follow these steps:

step.para: Launch the MS ODBC Administrator. For example, on Windows 7, select StartAll Programs Trafodion ODBC 1.0MS ODBC Administrator .
In the ODBC Data Source Administrator dialog box, select the User DSN tab, and click Add.
Select the TRAF ODBC 1.0 driver, and then click Finish.
A new dialog box appears, prompting you to create a new data source.
Enter the name of the data source, Default_DataSource, and click Next to continue.
Enter the IP address and port number of the Trafodion system to which will be connecting. The port number must be 23400. Click Next to continue.
Select the default schema. If you do not select a schema, the default is USR. Click Next to continue.

If desired, configure the translate dll, which translates data from one character set to another, and configure the localization. By default, the client error message language is English, and the client’s local character set is used. Click Next to continue.
If desired, set the trace options and the file path of the trace log. Click Finish.
The Test Trafodion ODBC Connection dialog box appears, allowing you to test the connection using the data source that you created.
Click Test Connection.
When prompted, enter your username and password, and click OK.
If the connection is successful, you will see Connected Successfully in the Test Trafodion ODBC Connection dialog box.

section.title: Enabling Compression
section.para: When compression is enabled in the ODBC driver, the ODBC driver can send and receive large volumes of data quickly and efficiently to and from the Trafodion Database Connectivity Services (DCS) server over a TCP/IP network. By default, compression is disabled.
To enable compression in the ODBC driver or to change the compression setting, follow these steps:

step.para: Launch the MS ODBC Administrator. For example, on Windows 7, select StartAll Programs Trafodion ODBC 1.0MS ODBC Administrator .
In the ODBC Data Source Administrator dialog box, select the User DSN tab, select the name of your data source under User Data Sources, and click Configure. If you did not create a data source, see .
A new dialog box appears, showing the configuration of your data source.
Select the Network tab, and then select one of these values for Compression:

listitem.para: SYSTEM_DEFAULT, which is the same as no compression
An integer from 0 to 9, with 0 being no compression and 9 being the maximum available compression

step.para: Click OK to accept the change.
Click OK to exit the ODBC Data Source Administrator dialog box.

section.title: Enabling Compression
section.para: When compression is enabled in the ODBC driver, the ODBC driver can send and receive large volumes of data quickly and efficiently to and from the Trafodion Database Connectivity Services (DCS) server over a TCP/IP network. By default, compression is disabled.
To enable compression in the ODBC driver or to change the compression setting, follow these steps:

listitem.para: If you are using the Trafodion ODBC driver manager, add Compression = compression-level to the DSN section of TRAFDSN file.
If you are using a third-party driver manager, such as unixODBC, add Compression = compression-level to the DSN section of the odbc.ini file.

section.para: The compression-level is one of these values:

listitem.para: SYSTEM_DEFAULT, which is the same as no compression
An integer from 0 to 9, with 0 being no compression and 9 being the maximum available compression

note.para: For better performance, we recommend that you use at least version 2.3.x of unixODBC.

listitem.para: If you are using an external driver manager, you must point to libtrafodbc_drvr64.so and not to libtrafodbc64.so.
The driver, libtrafodbc_l64_drvr.so, has been verified with iODBC and unixODBC driver managers.
These driver managers, as well as documentation, can be found at these Web sites:
The three environment variables that control tracing are:
HPODBC_TRACE_LEVEL — sets trace level (ERROR, WARNING, CONFIG, INFO, or DEBUG)
HPODBC_TRACEFILE_NAME — specifies the name of the log file
HPODBC_TRACEFILE_SIZE — specifies the maximum files size of the log files

For information on the necessary data-source configuration options, you will need to add to the respective configuration files (for example, to odbc.ini). For more information, see the Trafodion ODBC API Guide.

section.para: The Query Plan allows you perform a visual explain plan on a Trafodion query.

Additionally you can use the Options button to pre-execute some SQL statements before the actual query. For example, you can set the preferred schema or specify a set of control query options. You can enter these options as a set of separate statements separated by semicolons.
Finally, you can use the Execute button to execute the query and view the output in a tabular format.

section.title: Using the Query Whiteboard
section.para: The Query Whiteboard allows you execute queries against your trafodion database. While the Query Plan page only lets you execute one query at a time, the Query Whiteboard page lets you create several statements as independent queries and execute them in parallel.

step.para: Enter the query text in the Query text box.
Click on the Run button to execute the query.
The results will be displayed in a tabular grid.
Click on the Add Query button to add a new query statement to your list. This allows you to maintain a list of statements and their results. You can also execute these statements in parallel.
Use the Download CSV button to export the tabular result to a CSV file.
